intro: Galium sylvestre var. curtifolium, commonly known as the short-leaved wood avens, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
